item.title: Version 2.3.11
item.description:
[2.3.11] - 2026-02-12

Added

  • SVG Export: Export circuits as scalable vector graphics
  • Available in File → Export as Image with .svg option
  • Supports grid lines, color/B&W/grayscale modes, and multiple scale factors
  • Perfect for documentation and high-quality prints
  • Mouse Panning: Pan the canvas using the mouse
  • Cmd+Drag (macOS) or trackpad gestures for smooth navigation
  • Works alongside existing keyboard arrow key panning
  • Rotation Keybind: Press 'R' to rotate selected gates
  • Quick keyboard shortcut for faster circuit building
  • Complements the existing rotation functionality
  • Keyboard Shortcuts Dialog: View → Keyboard Shortcuts shows all available shortcuts
  • Platform-specific key mappings (Cmd on macOS, Ctrl elsewhere)
  • Comprehensive list of file, edit, view, and gate operations

Fixed

  • Critical: Save error handling and data loss prevention
  • Files are now only marked as saved AFTER successful write to disk
  • Added comprehensive I/O error checking with specific, actionable error messages:
  • Permission denied
  • Disk full/quota exceeded
  • Read-only filesystem
  • Network/I/O errors
  • Prevents silent data loss on Linux with NFS mounts, disk quotas, or filesystem errors
  • Users now receive clear error dialogs instead of losing work
  • Critical: Version comparison bug that prevented opening v2 files
  • Fixed lexicographic string comparison bug where "2.3.9" > "2.3.11"
  • Now uses proper numeric version comparison
  • Changed to only block files with newer major versions (breaking changes)
  • Files from any 2.x version can now open in other 2.x versions
  • Linux Build: Fixed OpenGL framebuffer compilation errors
  • Added GL_GLEXT_PROTOTYPES for proper extension function declarations
  • Ensures image export features work correctly on Linux
  • Export Dialog: Restored v1.x print-style compatibility for legacy format exports

Changed

  • Save operations now provide detailed error messages instead of generic failures
  • File close warnings now properly detect unsaved changes after failed saves
  • Window title now shows cleaner version without build timestamp (e.g., "Cedar Logic 2.3.11")

Full Changelog: https://github.com/taciturnaxolotl/CedarLogic/compare/v2.3.10...v2.3.11
